definition: in large numbers/in force/lit. clouds bubbling up
surname Yun/abbr. for Yunnan Province 雲南省|云南省[Yun2 nan2 Sheng3]
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds

sentences.english: The ongoing urbanization process is ceaselessly moving forward in China.
sentences.chinese: 中国的城市化正在风起云涌地展开。

sentences.english: In the recent rebound in prices, junk stocks is surging.
sentences.chinese: 在近期的反弹行情中，垃圾股走势可谓风起云涌。

sentences.english: Spring 1970. The social revolution was in full swing.
sentences.chinese: 1970年的春天，社会变革潮起云涌。

sentences.english: There are sudden changes and powerful rivalries in Chinese television market.
sentences.chinese: 中国电视市场，群雄纷争，风起云涌。

sentences.english: Every time I see his work, I also feel the waves of movement.
sentences.chinese: 看秦风的作品，也有风起云涌的感觉。

sentences.english: With the development of the economic integration of the world, the transnational merger and acquisition activities have grown rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 随着世界经济一体化的迅猛发展，跨国并购风起云涌。

sentences.english: The western counter - tobacco movement will start blustery from now on.
sentences.chinese: 西方反烟草运动自此开始风起云涌。

sentences.english: Electronic map of home uses the market like a rising wind and scudding clouds.
sentences.chinese: 国内的电子地图应用市场正风起云涌。

sentences.english: Nowadays, the technology is undergoing great changes, and more and more new technologies are emerging.
sentences.chinese: 当今世界，技术变革日新月异，新兴技术风起云涌。

definition: to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
to pursue deer/fig. to vie for supremacy
lit. foul wind and bloody rain (idiom)/fig. reign of terror/carnage
to spring up everywhere/from all around
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
